caption: Calif. Congressional member Barbara Boxer - (D-California)
Calif. Congressional member Dianne Feinstein - (D-California)
Citizenship: yes - pathway to earned citizenship that requires undocumented immigrants pay taxes and fines, pass background checks and learn English
STEM visas: yes
Ag worker visas: yes

caption: Calif. Congressional member Karen Bass - (D-Los Angeles)
Citizenship: yes - It is not practical to deport 11 million undocumented immigrants living within our borders.
STEM visas: yes, but not at expense of diversity visas: Federal immigration policy should facilitate, not restrict the movement of highly skilled workers into the United States. We should provide a sufficient number of highly skilled immigrant visas to respond to the economic needs of the country. However we should not do this at the expense of the Diversity Visas Program, which is credited with providing an opportunity for immigrants from countries deemed to have low rates of immigration to the United States like those in Sub Saharan Africa.
Family-based visas: should include gay and lesbian partners
Ag worker visas: yes, but workers should have access to pathway to citizenship
E-verify: We should provide tools for employers to ensure the people they hire are eligible to work in the United States while making sure there are appropriate penalties for companies that knowingly hire undocumented workers once a system is in place.

caption: Calif. Congressional member Xavier Becerra - (D-Los Angeles)
Citizenship: One of 8 House members negotiating immigration bill that includes pathway to citizenship

caption: Calif. Congressional member Ami Bera - (D-Sacramento)
Calif. Congressional member Julia Brownley - (D-Ventura)
Citizenship: yes
STEM visas: Supportive of increasing. Need to find the right number so that businesses have access to the skilled workers they need without taking away jobs from Americans.
Family-based visas: should include gay and lesbian partners
Ag worker visas: Support discussions between farm workers and agricultural industry that would provide protections for farm workers and pathway to citizenship.
E-verify: Yes, but it has to be reliable and not overly burden businesses, or get in the way those eligible to work.

caption: Calif. Congressional member Ken Calvert - (R-Riverside)
Citizenship: "Some kind of legal status, though not citizenship, for undocumented immigrants already in the country if they meet a number of conditions. These conditions must include that the individual has lived in the U.S. for a certain period of time, a background check to ensure only law abiding individuals are permitted to remain, payment of all back taxes and an appropriate fine, and passing a basic English proficiency exam.”
E-verify: yes, mandatory

caption: Calif. Congressional member John Campbell - (R-Irvine)
Citizenship: yes, but - "some we don't want here, others that will have a path to legalization, and others a path to citizenship"
Ag worker visas: open to something like that if it works and is enforced without too much excessive cost - then it becomes a subsidy to ag industry
E-verify: "you obviously need something like that"
DREAM Act: "there's a lot of distinction being drawn now between people who came here illegally and the children of those people and I think that's a distinction which is credible."

caption: Calif. Congressional member Lois Capps - (D-Santa Barbara)
Citizenship: earned path to citizenship
STEM visas: Congresswoman Capps’ district is home to world class research institutions like UCSB and Cal Poly that contribute significantly to our local economy and have spawned numerous high tech small businesses. She support reforms to the current STEM visa program that help foster economic growth and innovation.
Family-based visas: She has co-sponsored standalone legislation to change current policy regarding gay and lesbian partners because our current policy is discriminatory and ineffective.
Ag worker visas: yes - supports comprehensive immigration reform that ensures a stable agriculture workforce, protects the rights of agriculture workers; and provides an earned path to citizenship
E-verify: does not support mandatory e-verify in the absence of comprehensive immigration reform

caption: Calif. Congressional member Tony Cardenas - (D-North Hollywood, Sun Valley)
Calif. Congressional member Judy Chu - (D-El Monte)
Citizenship: "must have a roadmap to citizenship for the 11 million residents that are in the shadows"
STEM visas: "We benefit greatly if we are able to have STEM visas which would allow those who are educated in America to stay here and keep their innovations and their inventions here."
Family-based visas: must be reformed: "we have a broken system where people are waiting over 20 years to bring their loved ones from the homeland. Families are what makes people strong."
Other visa issues: "The pie should be larger. We have visas that go unused and we should at least have a provision there to use up the quota that already exists."
E-verify: "We need to have a system that actually works. ANd there are a lot of problems with E-verify."

caption: Calif. Congressional member Paul Cook - (R-Barstow)
Calif. Congressional member Jim Costa  - (D-Fresno)
Citizenship: yes
STEM visas: He believes in the principles behind the STEM Act, but he does not believe Congress should be playing favorites to one industry over another in the immigration debate.
Ag worker visas: the H2-A program has become too bureaucratic and inefficient to meet the needs of agriculture in California and nationwide. This issue must be addressed in comprehensive immigration reform.
E-verify: so long as it remains voluntary

caption: Calif. Congressional member Susan Davis - (D-San Diego)
Citizenship:
yes - Complete immigration reform should provide for
border security and a fair path for the vast majority who are already here
and who have demonstrated their productivity and conducted themselves with
trouble free records."
STEM visas: I am eager to support a plan that provides the companies in our San Diego innovation economy with the skilled workers they need to grow and thrive.
Family-based visas:
“Acceptance
of
immigration
status
should
not
be
based
on
whom
you
love.
I’ve
heard
from
so
many
of
my
constituents
who

at

someone
they
have
been

to

our

differently

married
heterosexual
couples.”
DREAM Act:
yes - "The toll our current immigration policies have taken on families,
especially the children who were brought here through no fault of their
own, has been troubling.

caption: Calif. Congressional member Jeff Denham - (R-Fresno)
Citizenship: yes, but: "we have to have a system that follows the rule of law" - "a way to show your oath to citizenship as well as being able to speak English"
Ag worker visas: yes
E-verify: yes
Border security: "something that strenghtens and protects our borders"
Misc: "something that strenghtens and protects our borders"

caption: Calif. Congressional member Anna Eshoo - (D-Palo Alto)
Calif. Congressional member Sam Farr - (D-Santa Cruz)
Citizenship: yes - pathway to citizenship as all immigrants before them have had, provided they go to the back of the line and pay any reasonable fines.
Family-based visas:
should include gay and lesbian partners - "Family reunification should include all families, regardless of sexual orientation.
"
Ag worker visas: yes
E-verify: Moving forward, there should be appropriate fines/punishment for those who are here illegally and the employers who hire them. He supports the concept of e-verify but not the current implementation, so he would either be looking at an improved e-verify or a drastically new system.

caption: Calif. Congressional member John Garamendi - (D-Walnut Creek)
Citizenship: yes, for immigrants already in the country who work hard and play by the rules. He believes it’s appropriate to ask undocumented immigrants who have not paid taxes to pay back taxes and a fine. The Congressman believes we should deport undocumented immigrants who are a threat to America.
STEM visas: yes
Family-based visas: believes gay and lesbian immigrants should be treated equally under the law
Ag worker visas: yes - provided that program includes adequate protections for workers
E-verify: doesn't like E-verify: we should expect employers to verify the legal working status of an immigrant, especially once all immigrants are registered and regularized as part of a comprehensive plan, but that the current system is often too expensive for small businesses and needs to be made more efficient

caption: Calif. Congressional member Janice Hahn - (D-San Pedro)
Calif. Congressional member Mike Honda - (D-San Jose)
Citizenship: yes

caption: Calif. Congressional member Jared Huffman - (D-San Rafael)
Calif. Congressional member Duncan Hunter - (R-El Cajon)
Citizenship: no - amnesty is not an option. (assuming we can secure border) There is possibly room for a process that leans on the legal immigration system, but blanket amnesty--no way.
Border security: border security will need to be first and foremost, with some metric verifying that the border is secure
Misc: border security will need to be first and foremost, with some metric verifying that the border is secure

caption: Calif. Congressional member Darrell Issa - (R-Vista)
Citizenship: yes, but - The 11 million here fall into 3 categories: "at least one of the 11 million should be allowed to stay and if they choose to at some point become a citizen; at least one of those people should be ordered out as a criminal, as an undesirable of many sorts; and at least one of them should be a guestworker, given a permit to remain here, to work, in some cases with family, and in many cases without the ability to have additional non-working dependents.The question is how many in each." "If you allow someone to remain in this country for the rest of their life, they cannot in my opinion under any circumstances, be treated as a second-class citizen." Cites 4 examples: exclusion of African-Americans as citizens at country's founding, exclusion of Native Americans until half a century plus after African-Americans granted it, Chinese exclusion act
E-verify: "at least mandatory E-verify with strong penalties. Supports work site enforcement to prevent benefits like Medicare, Medicaid, Social Security, welfare, aid to families with dependent children

caption: Calif. Congressional member Doug LaMalfa - (R-Redding)
Citizenship: "ongoing discussion" "I think you need to talk to the public about that because they're the ones paying the bills" "The first thing you have to establish is who are the people who shouldn't have any business here at all. You've got criminals here, you've got other undesirables that are cast off by their nation that we've become a dumping ground for perhaps."
Ag worker visas: yes
DREAM Act: hears from constituents who's own kids don't get similar benefits
Border security: "We are a sovereign nation, we have that right." "It's not a wall, it's a gate, a gate that we have the right to open and close as the country sees fit with the amount of people you want to come over." need secure borders for credibility, have to establish control of our borders "as the first step" Or else it looks like "the Lucy pulling the football away from Charlie Brown like 1986" where we had "an amnesty and nobody trusted anybody out there on the issue"
Misc: "We are a sovereign nation, we have that right." "It's not a wall, it's a gate, a gate that we have the right to open and close as the country sees fit with the amount of people you want to come over." need secure borders for credibility, have to establish control of our borders "as the first step" Or else it looks like "the Lucy pulling the football away from Charlie Brown like 1986" where we had "an amnesty and nobody trusted anybody out there on the issue"

caption: Calif. Congressional member Barbara Lee - (D-Oakland)
Citizenship: yes
STEM visas: yes
E-verify: E-Verify is a flawed system that would essentially allow employers to act as immigration agents by requiring them to determine an individual's legal status. E-Verify allows employers to exploit workers by paying them under the table and getting around other workplace protections.
Border security: As a country we spend more money on immigration enforcement than on the FBI, Secret Service, Drug Enforcement Administration, U.S. Marshal Service, Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives combined. Enforcement is at an all-time high and increasing it would be a waste of taxpayer dollars.
Misc: As a country we spend more money on immigration enforcement than on the FBI, Secret Service, Drug Enforcement Administration, U.S. Marshal Service, Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives combined. Enforcement is at an all-time high and increasing it would be a waste of taxpayer dollars.

caption: Calif. Congressional member Zoe Lofgren - (D-San Jose)
Citizenship: One of 8 House members negotiating immigration bill that includes pathway to citizenship
E-verify: "Expanding E-Verify—even as part of a broader immigration reform effort—without ensuring that proper safeguards are in place, is just one more way in which E-Verify would not benefit American workers."

caption: Calif. Congressional member Alan Lowenthal - (D-Long Beach)
Calif. Congressional member Doris Matsui - (D-Sacramento)
Calif. Congressional member Kevin McCarthy - (R-Bakersfield)
Calif. Congressional member Tom McClintock - (R-Granite Bay)
Calif. Congressional member Buck McKeon - (R-Santa Clarita)
Citizenship: legalization, but no pathway to citizenship
STEM visas: yes
Ag worker visas: yes - would be open to other unskilled labor visas

caption: Calif. Congressional member Jerry McNerney - (D-Pleasanton)
Calif. Congressional member Gary Miller - (R-San Bernardino)
Calif. Congressional member George Miller - (D-Martinez)
Calif. Congressional member Grace Napolitano - (D-Santa Fe Springs)
Calif. Congressional member Gloria Negrete McLeod - (D-Ontario)
Citizenship: What about something short of citizenship - say legalization? "I don't know. But I guess there's people here who have green cards who don't vote."
STEM visas: "That's probably good, you probably need it in some professions.
Ag worker visas: supports, provided that workers weren't being taken advantage of
E-verify: "How far do you want an employer to verify?
DREAM Act: yes - "I think those kids that came through no volition of their own, came here with their parents and they've gone through the schools here, they've pledged allegiance every day when they're in school to this country, this is the only country they know, this is their country, so I think giving them a path to some kind of citizenship is terrific."
Border security: "I want to make sure that we're not only safeguarding the southern borders, but that we're also safeguarding the northern borders. I know when most people think about immigration, they think of brown skinned people like me, not white skinned people."
Misc: "I want to make sure that we're not only safeguarding the southern borders, but that we're also safeguarding the northern borders. I know when most people think about immigration, they think of brown skinned people like me, not white skinned people."

caption: Calif. Congressional member Devin Nunes - (R-Tulare)
Citizenship: "I don't think there is any problem with what the President said in his speech. I think most Americans will say, 'look, as long as the people that didn't commit a crime, pass a background check, that go through this process, borders secure, I don't think people in the United States will have a problem with dealing with it fairly."
STEM visas: yes
Ag worker visas: yes
E-verify: yes

caption: Calif. Congressional member Nancy Pelosi - (D-San Francisco)
Citizenship: yes
STEM visas: yes
Ag worker visas: agrees with Congressional Hispanic Caucus that these workers should have path to citizenship
E-verify: a workable employment verification system that prevents unlawful employment and rewards employers and employees who play by the rules, while protecting Americans’ right to work and their privacy
DREAM Act: The DREAM Act is the right thing to do—both economically and morally for our country, and it is for young people who mostly know no other home.
Border security: We just want to make sure that all of those who have joined with us are not, are not saying, not setting a standard of securing the border that is almost impossible to achieve.
Misc: We just want to make sure that all of those who have joined with us are not, are not saying, not setting a standard of securing the border that is almost impossible to achieve.

caption: Calif. Congressional member Scott Peters - (D-San Diego)
Citizenship: "We want to make sure that we have a rational way to deal with the 11 million people who are undocumented here." Would he accept legalization over a path to citizenship? "I don't think now is the time to draw really hard lines. Now is the time to listen about how to make this better."
STEM visas: "We are facing a deficit of those folks in our technology sector. We want to make sure that's taken care of."
E-verify: "If we get the laws right, I think worker verification makes sense. Right now, forcing employers to be cops doesn't make sense. I would be okay with something like E-verify once the laws are in place that make sense."

caption: Calif. Congressional member Dana Rohrabacher - (R-Huntington Beach)
Citizenship: no - "I cannot accept any legislation that includes normalizing the status, legalizing the status of people who are here illegally. That would do nothing but bring more millions of people here to the United States in order to have their status normalized and put their families into a position to get benefits and take jobs."
STEM visas: would look at this seriously
Ag worker visas: yes if coupled with study to see whether prisoners could do the job
Other visa issues: not for other low-wage jobs like waiting tables
E-verify: yes

caption: Calif. Congressional member Lucille Roybal-Allard - (D-Commerce)
Citizenship: yes
STEM visas: yes
Family-based visas: should include gay and lesbian partners
Ag worker visas: yes
E-verify: yes, but: She recognizes that E-Verify expansion will inevitably be part of the compromise; but we need strong worker protections under the E-Verify title of the bill.

caption: Calif. Congressional member Ed Royce - (R-Fullerton)
Calif. Congressional member Raul Ruiz - (D-Palm Springs)
Calif. Congressional member Linda Sanchez - (D-Lakewood)
Citizenship: earned path to citizenship
STEM visas: only as part of a broader, comprehensive immigration reform package
Family-based visas: Would support including gay and lesbian couples in family reunification
Ag worker visas: only as part of a broader, comprehensive immigration reform package
E-verify: Would support improved E-verify only as part of a broader, comprehensive immigration reform package.
Border security: only as part of a broader, comprehensive immigration reform package
Misc: only as part of a broader, comprehensive immigration reform package

caption: Calif. Congressional member Loretta Sanchez - (D-Anaheim)
Calif. Congressional member Adam Schiff - (D-Glendale)
Citizenship: "has to be some pathway to citizenship for them. I agree with the President that they should pay back taxes and learn civics and get in line behind those that are llegally trying to immigrate."
Family-based visas: yes - and "there should be provisions in it for same-sex couples so that they can also make sure their loved ones can emigrate."
Ag worker visas: still a strong need for them
Other visa issues: Track tourist visas so people can't overstay their visas - it's at least 40% of our immigration problem"
E-verify: "I do think we need to disincentivize people from coming here illegally for jobs. E-verify is a method for doing that. Undoubtedly there can be ways to improve E-verify or maybe come up with a better system. There needs to be some mechanism, though, where we can determine who's legally eligible for employment and who isn't. And we can do so in a way that doesn't require employers to try to stereotype people."

caption: Calif. Congressional member Brad Sherman - (D-Sherman Oaks)
Calif. Congressional member Jackie Speier - (D-San Mateo)
Calif. Congressional member Eric Swalwell - (D-Livermore)
Citizenship: He believes we must have a meaningful mechanism for undocumented persons to become legal residents and citizens
STEM visas: yes
Family-based visas: must include gay and lesbian partners
Border security: must include improvements to secure our borders and remove from this country undocumented immigrants who have committed serious crimes after they serve their sentences.
Misc: must include improvements to secure our borders and remove from this country undocumented immigrants who have committed serious crimes after they serve their sentences.

caption: Calif. Congressional member Mark Takano - (D-Riverside)
Citizenship: yes
STEM visas: yes
Family-based visas: should include provisions for gay and lesbian partners: believes the federal government should recognize the rights of gay and lesbian partners of immigrants and include a provision that allows family reunification regardless of ones sexual orientation.
Ag worker visas: yes, but any immigration legislation should include provisions that prevent unscrupulous employers from taking advantage of them
E-verify: yes
Border security: illegal border crossings are the lowest they’ve been in many years. Congressman Takano believes that our border should remain secure and properly enforced
Misc: illegal border crossings are the lowest they’ve been in many years. Congressman Takano believes that our border should remain secure and properly enforced

caption: Calif. Congressional member Mike Thompson - (D-St. Helena)
Calif. Congressional member David Valadao - (R-Hanford)
Citizenship: About 50% of the 11 million have tried to go through the system and given up; the other half - the ones here "causing problems" find a way to get rid of them; "the ones that are doing a good job, working and doing everything right, raising a family and doing good for their family, we've gotta find a way to make sure that we give them the opportunity to give them the American dream just like my parents did."
STEM visas: yes - "We have businesses investing outside of the United States because of a lack of people who can do those jobs."
Ag worker visas: yes
Other visa issues: " I have people in my district that have been waiting 20 years to get some kind of status. About 50% of the people who are here undocumented today have tried to go through the system and have given up because of how long it takes."

caption: Calif. Congressional member Juan Vargas - (D-Chula Vista)
Calif. Congressional member Maxine Waters - (D-Los Angeles)
Calif. Congressional member Henry Waxman - (D-Los Angeles)
Citizenship: yes
Ag worker visas: yes
E-verify: verification would be helpful so employers can act in a prudent way
